description.narrative: The project aims to contribute to the social cohesion of Syrians under temporary protection (SuTP) with host communities in the Southeast Anatolia Region

participating-org.narrative: US DEPARTMENT OF STATE - Bureau of Population, Refugees and Migration

activity-description.narrative: Activities aimed at strengthening of municipal waste management capacities and enhancing of livelihood opportunities in waste recycling and related sectors
Activities aimed at strengthening of municipal waste management capacities and enhancing of livelihood opportunities in waste recycling and related sectors

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

provider-org.narrative: US DEPARTMENT OF STATE - Bureau of Population, Refugees and Migration
US DEPARTMENT OF STATE - Bureau of Population, Refugees and Migration
US DEPARTMENT OF STATE - Bureau of Population, Refugees and Migration
US DEPARTMENT OF STATE - Bureau of Population, Refugees and Migration

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of tailor made initiatives with incentivization schemes for households designed and operational. 1.2 Number of participating households. 1.3 Amount of recyclables collected via source segregation (tons per annum). 1.4 Number of pre-processing equipment along with smart and conventional waste collection equipment including drop off points for material recovery in Kilis to handle recyclables collected from the participatory waste projects. 1.5 Number of smart and conventional waste collection and management systems including drop off points installed in Sanliurfa for efficient transportation and process monitoring. 1.6 Percentage of savings per ton of solid waste achieved within operations at targeted province and districts. 2.1 Number women’s collectives established or existing ones supported to be made operational 2.2 Number of individuals enrolled in specific skills trainings on handicraft manufacturing from recycling operations. (At least 50% to be Syrians) 2.3 Percentage of point to product conversion as a marker for active participation and obtained benefits from incentivization programme. 2.4 Number of volunteer community wardens trained for participatory waste management and environment for every sub district. 2.5 Number of positively resulted impact assessments on social cohesion by participatory waste management

comment.narrative: baseline year : 2019 baseline value : 0 for below indicators

10,000 participating households. 2500 Amount of recyclables collected via source segregation (tons per annum). 3 pre-processing equipment along with smart and conventional waste collection equipment including drop off points for material recovery in Kilis to handle recyclables collected from the participatory waste projects. 20% Percentage of savings per ton of solid waste achieved within operations at targeted province and districts. 2 women’s collectives established or existing ones supported to be made operational 200 individuals enrolled in specific skills trainings on handicraft manufacturing from recycling operations. (At least 50% to be Syrians) 90% of point to product conversion as a marker for active participation and obtained benefits from incentivization programme. 104 volunteer community wardens trained for participatory waste management and environment for every sub district. 2 positively resulted impact assessments on social cohesion by participatory waste management

1 tailor made initiatives with incentivization schemes for households designed and operational. 8,389 of participating households. 2500 Amount of recyclables collected via source segregation (tons per annum). 3 pre-processing equipment along with smart and conventional waste collection equipment including drop off points for material recovery in Kilis to handle recyclables collected from the participatory waste projects. 1,2% of savings per ton of solid waste achieved within operations at targeted province and districts. 2 women’s collectives established or existing ones supported to be made operational 125 individuals enrolled in specific skills trainings on handicraft manufacturing from recycling operations. (At least 50% to be Syrians) 1.2.3 Percentage of point to product conversion as a marker for active participation and obtained benefits from incentivization programme. (Data not exists) 412 volunteer community wardens trained for participatory waste management and environment for every sub district. 2 positively resulted impact assessments on social cohesion by participatory waste management

2 tailor made initiatives with incentivization schemes for households designed and operational. 2,000 participating households. 500 Amount of recyclables collected via source segregation (tons per annum). 10% Percentage of savings per ton of solid waste achieved within operations at targeted province and districts. 1 women’s collectives established or existing ones supported to be made operational 100 individuals enrolled in specific skills trainings on handicraft manufacturing from recycling operations. (At least 50% to be Syrians) 65% of point to product conversion as a marker for active participation and obtained benefits from incentivization programme. 64 volunteer community wardens trained for participatory waste management and environment for every sub district. 1 positively resulted impact assessments on social cohesion by participatory waste management

(At least 50% to be Syrians) 90% of point to product conversion as a marker for active participation and obtained benefits from incentivization programme. 40 volunteer community wardens trained for participatory waste management and environment for every sub district. 1 positively resulted impact assessments on social cohesion by participatory waste management

(At least 50% to be Syrians) 90% of point to product conversion as a marker for active participation and obtained benefits from incentivization programme. 40 volunteer community wardens trained for participatory waste management and environment for every sub district. 1 positively resulted impact assessments on social cohesion by participatory waste management
